Modification_Detail.description: Added Alias_List; revised description for consistency with other Venera products; added External_References

External_Reference.reference_text: Vernov, S. N., et al., A study of characteristics of proton fluxes measured on SC VENERA-13 and VENERA-14, (in Russian), Kosmicheskie Issledovaniya, vol. 21, no. 13, 449-453, 1983.

Ermakov, S. I., Kontor, N. N., Lyubimov, G. P., Pereslegina, N. V., Tulupov, V. I., Chuchkov, E.A., Case analysis of proton fluxes in the interplanetary medium using data from SC VENERA-13 and VENERA-14, (in Russian), Kosmicheskie Issledovaniya, 1983, vol. 21, no. 13, 466-475, 1983.

Ermakov, S. I., Kontor, N. N., Lyubimov, G. P., Pereslegina, N. V., Tulupov, V. I., Chuchkov, E. A., Variations of Solar Proton Anisotropy on November 10-11 1981, 18th Cosmic Ray Conf., Proc., vol. 4, 162-164, 1983.

Instrument.name: Venera 13 Energetic Particles, MSU-TASPD
Instrument.description: The Venera 13 Energetic Particles experiment was a Soviet suite of particle detectors that monitored the flux of charged particles of medium energies in interplanetary space during cruise and Venus flyby, specifically measuring at 20-min intervals protons (>30 and 1-3 MeV) from the sunward direction and protons (1-3 MeV) from the anti-sunward direction; and measuring simultaneously, at 80-min intervals, protons (2-3, 3-5, and 5-8 MeV) from both the sunward and anti-sunward directions.
